src:
Vojvodina izdržala 50 minuta protiv šampiona Evrope
Vardar savladao Novosađane sa 26:23

04 Nov 2019

Šampion Evrope Vardar je upisao i petu pobedu u SEHA rukometnoj ligi protiv Vojvodine od 26:23. Trijumfu najboljeg tima na kontinentu posebnu težinu daje činjenica da je zabeležen samo 24 časa nakon utakmice u okviru Lige šampiona sa Meškovim Brestom pa treneru Eduardu Kokšarovu nije bilo lako da vodi tim.
Vojvodina se ispostavila kao žilav protivnik, posebno u prvom poluvremenu kada je Vardar eksperimentisao i igrao sa maldim rukometašima. Neizvesnost utakmice trajala je oko 50 minuta kada je na semaforu bilo 20:20, ali je makedonski tim sa tri vezana gola i serijom od 5:1 prelomio meč u svoju korist.    
Najefikasniji u redovima tima iz Skoplja bio je Slovenac Staš Skube sa sedam golova, Dimitroski je postigao šest, a Hrvat Ivan Čupić pet. Golman Vardara Kugis imao je 11 odbrana.
Na drugoj strani u redovima Lala Strahinja Stanković je dao sedam golova, dok su Nemanja Ratković i Jovica Nikolić pogađali po četiri puta. Golman Novosađana Luka Arsenić imao je 19 odbrana.

text:
Vojvodina endured 50 minutes against European champions
Vardar defeated the Novi Sad with 26:23

04 Nov 2019

European champion Vardar also recorded the fifth win in the SEHA Handball League against Vojvodina in 26:23. The triumph of the best team on the continent is given particular weight by the fact that it was recorded only 24 hours after the Champions League match with Meshkov Brest, so it was not easy for coach Eduard Koksharov to lead the team.
Vojvodina turned out to be a tough opponent, especially in the first half when Vardar experimented with and played with the minor handball players. The match uncertainty lasted about 50 minutes when the scoreboard was 20:20, but the Macedonian team with three tied goals and a 5-1 series broke the match in their favor.
The most efficient player in the team from Skopje was Slovenian Staš Skube with seven goals, Dimitroski scored six and Croatian Ivan Cupic five. Goalkeeper Vardara Kugis had 11 defenses.
On the other side of Lala Strahinja's ranks, Stankovic scored seven goals, while Nemanja Ratkovic and Jovica Nikolic scored four times each. Novi Sad goalkeeper Luka Arsenić had 19 defenses.
